data.title: Denton County, Texas
data.meta_description: Denton County, Texas | 6,345 followers on LinkedIn. Denton County is located on the north side of the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex.  Denton County was established by the Texas legislature on April 11, 1846.  As of the 2010 census, its population was 662,614 and is one of the fastest growing counties in the United States.
data.text:
For our #PeopleofDentonCounty, we proudly salute our Women Veterans. This incredible group, many of whom are current or former employees of Denton County, have honorably served in various military branches, including the Army, Navy, Air Force, and the Reserves.ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ The Denton County Commissioners Court recently had the privilege of honoring the courageous women who have served in our armed forces. We celebrated their dedication and sacrifice with a special breakfast and proclamation ceremony. During Commissioners Court, each veteran was presented with a unique quilt from Quilts of Valor Texas. The mission of Quilts of Valor is to bestow a universal symbol and token of thanks, solace, and remembrance on those who served in harmâ€™s way to protect and defend our lives and freedoms. These beautiful quilts are lovingly made by the hands of countless volunteers who wish to express their gratitude and honor the service and sacrifice of our veterans. Thank you to all the women veterans for your unwavering commitment to protecting our freedom. Your service and dedication inspire us all.

This morning, the Denton County Sheriff's Office hosted its annual Law Enforcement Fallen Officers Memorial at the Denton County Administrative Courthouse Amphitheater. We gathered to honor the brave men and women who sacrificed their lives in the line of duty. The ceremony included the Presentation of Colors, a proclamation reading by Denton County Judge Andy Eads, a rendition of the national anthem by the Denton High School Choir, and heartfelt speeches from guest speakers. The Roll Call of Officers, followed by a 3-Volley Rifle Salute, was particularly impactful. As each name was read, an officer placed a flower in the memorial wreath, symbolizing the unity of our entire county. May we always remember and honor the fallen who served their fellow citizens, especially those from Denton County.

We are growing to better support Denton County. Join an innovative and rewarding IT team dedicated to supporting and empowering Denton County departments and agencies in providing excellent service to our citizens. Denton County is a great place to work and offers a full range of employee benefit programs. Several IT positions are available, including Application Support Administrator (Public Safety & Courts Technology Support), Computer Technician (TEMP), ERP Systems Administrator (Workday), Network Operations Manager, Security Analyst (Information Security), and Senior Server Engineer. Denton County is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Apply here: https://lnkd.in/gaA_qGzK

This National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, we want to offer a heartfelt salute to the heroes who stand on the front lines for our safety! In Denton County, we proudly recognize and thank our 621 dedicated peace officers â€“ a third of our incredible county workforce. These men and women, from the Sheriffâ€™s Office to our Constable's Office to the Fire Marshalâ€™s Office and other county departments, undergo rigorous training to protect and serve our county. Join us in expressing our gratitude for their unwavering commitment. #DentonCountyStrong #ProtectAndServe #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay #ThankYou
